page.title: 07GOOLE MARKET
page.content: A{market}has been held in Goole for approximately 130 years. It is now situated at the junction of Boothferry Road and Gladstone Terrace,near many local shops and stores. The market is open every Wednesday,Friday and Saturday from 6.45 a.m. to 5.30 p.m. Approximately 70 regular{traders}hold stalls in two large halls. The old hall (opened in 1896) covers an area of 12,000 sq.ft. The new hall ( opened in 1983) has an area of 14,000 sq.ft. and has replaced the outdoor market. The majority of traders come from S.Yorkshire and W.Yorkshire. Stalls range in price from Â£4.25 to Â£6.65 per day depending on the length. { Stalls}in the market sell a variety of things : clothes, drapery,fruit and veg., meat, eggs, toys, pet supplies, plants, books, records and electrical goods.
